name: forfiles

procedures: T1005::[Forfiles] can be used to act on (ex: copy, move, etc.) files/directories in a system during (ex: copy files into a staging area before).
T1083::[Forfiles] can be used to locate certain types of files/directories in a system.(ex: locate all files with a specific extension, name, and/or age)
T1202::[Forfiles] can be used to subvert controls and possibly conceal command execution by not directly invoking [cmd].

description: [Forfiles](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0193) is a Windows utility commonly used in batch jobs to execute commands on one or more selected files or directories (ex: list all directories in a drive, read the first line of all files created yesterday, etc.). Forfiles can be executed from either the command line, Run window, or batch files/scripts. (Citation: Microsoft Forfiles Aug 2016)
